page.title: 02BRIDGELAND LAND SURVEY
page.content: Farmland Most of the fields are used for hay or silage which has been ruined this year (1985) by heavy rainfall. Corn fields have not been harvested for the same reason. Not all of the land is flat and fertile, the steep land is used for cattle and sheep as they can make best use of it. The river Ettrick runs through the middle of the Bridgelands on the north bank there is extraction of gravel. Trees There are many different kinds of trees in this area for example ash, rowan(mountain ash), beech, apple and sycamore. There are also a number of coniferous evergreens for example larch, spruce and cyprus.
